Performer:
Toyomatsu Seizaburō (see also Yoshida Seizaburō) (豊松清三郎)

Alternate Name: Yoshida Seizaburō (吉田清三郎)

Dates: '1979-1986/11'

Specialty: Puppeteer

Notes: Bunraku meikan (1980, 1985, 1988, 1990, 1994)


– Click image to view.


Performances as Puppeteer:

August 1984: The Murder in Revenge

September 1979: The Miracle at the Tsubosaka Kannon Temple

February 1980: The Love Suicide at Amijima

April 1980: The Battle of Kawanakajima

July 1980: The Bloodshed at Ise

September 1980: The New Usuyuki Story

October 1980: The New Usuyuki Story

December 1980 Bunraku Kanshō Kyōshitsu: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

January 1981: The Twenty-Four Dutiful Sons

January 1981: The Battle of Dannoura

February 1981: The Love Suicides at Amijima

July 1981: The Battles of Genji and Heike

November 1981: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

February 1982: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

July 1982: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

September 1982: The Nine-Tailed Fox

October 1982: The Adachi Plain in Oshu

December 1982: The Adachi Plain in Oshu

January 1983: Sugawara's Secrets of Calligraphy

February 1983: Gonza the Lancer

April 1983: The Story of Priest Roben

May 1983: The Three Generations of Kamakura Shoguns

July 1983: The Three Generations of Kamakura Shoguns

September 1983: Kagekiyo and His Daughter

October 1983: Kagekiyo and His Daughter

December 1983: The Twenty-Four Dutiful Sons

July 1980 Tour: The Battle of Ichinotani

February 1984: The Love Suicides at Amijima

June 1984: The Story of the Morning Glory

September 1984: The Murder in Revenge

October 1984: The Amorous Courier on the Yamato Highway

December 1984: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

February 1985: The Double Suicide at Ikudama

April 1985: The Tragedy of Love in Error

July 1985: The Drum of the Waves of Horikawa

January 1986: The Romance in the Gay Quarters

May 1986: The Vendetta in Iga

July 1986: The Bloodshed at Ise

October 1986: The Love Suicides at Amijima

June 1986 Bunraku Kanshō Kyōshitsu: The Battle of Ichinotani

December 1986 Bunraku Kanshō Kyōshitsu: The Love Suicides at Sonezaki
